intro: Ageratum salvanaturae, commonly known as the Salvanatura ageratum, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30 to 60 centimeters, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers come in shades of purple, blue, and white, often with a contrasting central disk. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and is often used in ornamental gardening for its vibrant blooms.
